      ;.n Cut Conjunction

A collection of 3 adverbs, collectively known as Cut, with different syntax and semantics.
which means they look different inside J code, and do different things.
The 3 adverbs are distinguished from each other by having different values of n in the phrase (;.n).
    * (;.0) (Reversed * Subarray)
    * (;.1), (;._1), (;.2), (;._2) (SelfIntervals * Intervals)
    * (;.3), (;._3) (MaxCubes * Subarrays)

NOTE: Strictly speaking, Cut is a conjunction, not an adverb. But as soon as we supply a right-hand operand n, as in (;.0) say, the result is an adverb, i.e. a modifier accepting only one operand.
